metadata.synopsis: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.

11.speaker: Thulla
11.context: NodeContext: She's sick and getting sicker

21.speaker: Thulla
21.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, angry at herself, doesn't want to deal with us. (This is in her 'healed' state)

27.speaker: Thulla
27.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
27.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

235.speaker: Thulla
235.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
235.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I know about the runepowder. I think I'll steer clear.
165.context: NodeContext: A beat - she's processing the fact that she didn't tell us the whole story and we STILL found out

155.speaker: Thulla
155.text: ... no fooling you. We've some scores to settle back in the Gate, aye.
155.context: NodeContext: A beat - she's processing the fact that she didn't tell us the whole story and we STILL found out

33.speaker: Thulla
33.text: But the Ironhands owe you a different kind of debt. Find us and we'll make good, that I promise.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Your leader is still locked up in Moonrise Towers.
18.context: NodeContext: Deflated at the loss of Wulbren but pragmatic about carrying on

2.speaker: Thulla
2.text: Aye, I heard about Wulbren. But the cause is bigger than any one of us.
2.context: NodeContext: Deflated at the loss of Wulbren but pragmatic about carrying on

243.speaker: Thulla
243.text: You've made sure his work is done, even if he's not there to see it. He'd be grateful.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: What will you do when you return?

106.speaker: Thulla
106.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

8.speaker: Thulla
8.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

36.speaker: Thulla
36.text: Ungh. Nick my boots and patch my wounds? An odd trade - but I'll take it.
36.context: NodeContext: A little resentful. Not in severe pain.

49.speaker: Thulla
49.context: NodeContext: Terse, through gritted teeth. Assumes we have ill-intent.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: *Her condition is familiar. Poison, derived from a wild weed common to the Underdark.*
41.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

67.text: *Her condition is familiar. Poison, derived from a wild weed common to the Underdark.*
67.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Her condition is familiar. Poison, derived from a wild weed common to the Underdark.*
57.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *She'll need an antidote soon - most likely held by the poisoner.*
139.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

37.speaker: Player
37.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

82.speaker: Thulla
82.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

209.speaker: Player
209.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her, Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

123.speaker: Thulla
123.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her, Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Sit tight. There must be some way to cure you.
91.context: NodeContext: As if stating the obvious.

240.speaker: Thulla
240.context: NodeContext: As if stating the obvious.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Sit tight. There must be more than one way to cure you.
121.context: NodeContext: Joyless 'hah',  forced through the pain

171.speaker: Player
171.text: If the duergar poisoned you, perhaps they have the cure.
171.context: NodeContext: Joyless 'hah',  forced through the pain

163.speaker: Thulla
163.context: NodeContext: Joyless 'hah',  forced through the pain

114.speaker: Player
114.text: How did you end up here?
114.context: NodeContext: 'agh!' is a sharp jab of pain while she's mid-sentence.

232.speaker: Thulla
232.text: Myconids - agh! - took pity on me. Sound lads - especially since the greys gave 'em hell for it.
232.context: NodeContext: 'agh!' is a sharp jab of pain while she's mid-sentence.

3.speaker: Thulla
3.text: These myconids are the welcoming sort, at least where blubbering gnomes are concerned.
3.context: NodeContext: Mildly impressed (and throwing a little shade at the druids met previously, who were unwelcoming towards refugees)

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: These myconids are the welcoming sort, at least where blubbering gnomes are concerned.
74.context: NodeContext: Mildly impressed (and throwing a little shade at the druids met previously, who were unwelcoming towards refugees)

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: Paragons of hospitality, these myconids. The druids in the grove could've learned a thing or two.
147.context: NodeContext: Mildly impressed (and throwing a little shade at the druids met previously, who were unwelcoming towards refugees)

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: Sound shrooms. Snake druids take note.

216.speaker: Astarion
216.text: Now that's hospitality. The fungus could teach our druid friends a thing or two.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: These myconids are the hospitable sort. Refreshing, after our run-in with Kagha.

182.speaker: Gale
182.text: Charitable bunch, these myconids. At least more so than Kagha and her pet snake.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Consider what you know of your people's poison lore.
156.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Consider what you know of duergar poison lore.
204.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

168.speaker: Narrator
168.text: *Like dwarves, duergar have innate resistance to poison - and thus no need for intricate brews.*

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *Like dwarves, duergar have innate resistance to poison - and thus no need for intricate brews.*

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *Though deadly if left untreated, the poison can be cured - by the antidote, or natural remedies.*

230.text: *Duergar society is shrouded in mystery. Nothing useful comes to mind.*

229.speaker: Narrator
229.text: *Duergar society is shrouded in mystery. Nothing useful comes to mind.*

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Consider what you know of duergar poison lore.
236.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

53.speaker: Player
53.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Give her the Elixir of Silvanus.
131.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

97.speaker: Player
97.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

38.speaker: Player
38.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

138.speaker: Thulla
138.text: Ah... Gods... whatever that is... I needed it.
138.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Give her an Elixir of Poison Resistance.
47.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Give her the noblestalk as a cure.
129.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

34.speaker: Thulla
34.text: Ah... Gods... whatever that is... I needed it.
34.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

7.text: Why're you helping me? You're one of them.
7.context: NodeContext: No longer in severe pain, but with a suspicious undercurrent. She doesn't know who the player is or if she can trust them (especially if they are a drow or duergar).

215.speaker: Thulla
215.context: NodeContext: No longer in severe pain, but with a suspicious undercurrent. She doesn't know who the player is or if she can trust them (especially if they are a drow or duergar).

68.speaker: Player
68.text: How could I pass by? You were in pain.
68.context: NodeContext: Tough and pragmatic. No self-pity here. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

73.speaker: Thulla
73.text: No arguments there. Felt like a hook horror was sorting through my guts.
73.context: NodeContext: Tough and pragmatic. No self-pity here. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

88.speaker: Thulla
88.text: But... ngh... that cure did the trick. Quick-sharp, too.
88.context: NodeContext: Checking in on her injuries, pleasantly surprised to feel better

108.speaker: Thulla
108.text: I thank you for your help, but I gotta get moving - ah!
108.context: NodeContext: Strain - tries to get up but falls down again - still weak.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *But was it truly nothing?  The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.
237.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

111.speaker: Player
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *Pain rushes through you from the wound on your hand. You glimpse yourself reaching to help a fellow initiate back on his feet, only to hear a female voice hiss your name in reprimand.*
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memory fragment - SH recalls being chastised foir helping another.

64.speaker: Player
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

104.speaker: Player
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Garl's garters, I don't have time for this. My kin need me.
51.context: NodeContext: Vehement frustration - she's healed but still too weak to move. 'Garl's garters' is a polite-ish swear in reference to gnomish god Garl Glittergold

66.speaker: Thulla
66.text: Garl's garters, I don't have time for this. My kin need me.
66.context: NodeContext: Vehement frustration - she's healed but still too weak to move. 'Garl's garters' is a polite-ish swear in reference to gnomish god Garl Glittergold

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You're in no condition to help anyone.
81.context: NodeContext: Begrudginly accepting, but eyeing us up

32.speaker: Thulla
32.text: Maybe not... but you are. I need you to rescue my kin.
32.context: NodeContext: Begrudginly accepting, but eyeing us up

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Take it easy and tell me what I can do.
46.context: NodeContext: Appreciative, but a little dubious that we'd be so kind

9.speaker: Thulla
9.text: ... seems you're the helping kind. All right - I need you to rescue my kin.
9.context: NodeContext: Appreciative, but a little dubious that we'd be so kind

145.speaker: Thulla
145.text: Not charity, mind - we can pay. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in Baldur's Gate.
145.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Focus on what I need. A reward, for starters.
164.context: NodeContext: Snorting with amusement - we're chancing our arm but she means to enlist our help

154.speaker: Thulla
154.text: You already relieved me of my boots. No hard feelings... once you use them to free my clan.
154.context: NodeContext: Snorting with amusement - we're chancing our arm but she means to enlist our help

220.speaker: Thulla
220.text: We can pay too, don't worry. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in the city.
220.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

12.speaker: Thulla
12.text: I owe you, sure enough. But I've nothing to give. If you were to free my kin...
12.context: NodeContext: Nodding, acknowledging her debt - but pragmatic. She can't pay us, but if we help her out her people can.

25.speaker: Thulla
25.text: We can pay. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in Baldur's Gate.
25.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

140.speaker: Thulla
140.text: We were on an expedition down here when the duergar snatched us up.
140.context: NodeContext: Shrug, evasive. She doesn't want to tell the truth and doesn't want us dwelling on it.

133.speaker: Thulla
133.text: I got away, but not the others. The greys have them digging out some old ruin across the lake.
133.context: NodeContext: Shrug, evasive. She doesn't want to tell the truth and doesn't want us dwelling on it.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: What was this expedition your clan were on?
61.context: NodeContext: Shrug, evasive. She doesn't want to tell the truth and doesn't want us dwelling on it.

190.speaker: Thulla
190.text: Just mining for materials. Nothing unusual.
190.context: NodeContext: Shrug, evasive. She doesn't want to tell the truth and doesn't want us dwelling on it.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: *The briefest hesitation, but enough. She's lying.*
176.context: NodeContext: Trying to seal the deal.

39.text: *The briefest hesitation, but enough. She's lying.*
39.context: NodeContext: Trying to seal the deal.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *The briefest hesitation, but enough. She's lying.*
44.context: NodeContext: Trying to seal the deal.

153.speaker: Thulla
153.text: But our work pays well. Help my clan and we'll make it worth your while. I swear.
153.context: NodeContext: Trying to seal the deal.

211.speaker: Player
211.context: NodeContext: Sighing and relenting - she doesn't want to get into her people's private business, but appreciates we deserve to know something

136.speaker: Thulla
136.text: ... fine. It's complicated, but my clan has trouble back in the city. A blood-feud.
136.context: NodeContext: Sighing and relenting - she doesn't want to get into her people's private business, but appreciates we deserve to know something

172.speaker: Thulla
172.text: ... fine. It's complicated, but my clan has trouble back in the city. A blood-feud.
172.context: NodeContext: Sighing and relenting - she doesn't want to get into her people's private business, but appreciates we deserve to know something

56.speaker: Thulla
56.text: We were searching for something to turn the tide. That's all I can say - but it's worth a lot to us. Understand?

69.text: I'm telling you we take care of our friends. That's no lie.
69.context: NodeContext: Being as honest as she can, but not trusting us with the full truth

87.speaker: Thulla
87.text: I'm telling you we take care of our friends. That's no lie.
87.context: NodeContext: Being as honest as she can, but not trusting us with the full truth

26.speaker: Player
26.text: No, I don't understand. Enough evasion and explain it.
26.context: NodeContext: Pragmatic, earnest - she wants to be honest with you but she can't . Take it or leave it.

146.speaker: Thulla
146.text: Look. You've done me a good turn, and you deserve the truth. But that's as much of it as I can tell - I swear it.
146.context: NodeContext: Pragmatic, earnest - she wants to be honest with you but she can't . Take it or leave it.

191.speaker: Thulla
191.text: If you need to go your own way, I respect that. But still... I'm asking.
191.context: NodeContext: Trying to be fair, but also earnest needing our help

94.speaker: Player
94.text: All right. I'll free your people if I can.
94.context: NodeContext: Earnestly grateful, frustrated she's too weak to come get revenge

50.speaker: Thulla
50.text: Thank you. Only wish I could go with you.
50.context: NodeContext: Earnestly grateful, frustrated she's too weak to come get revenge

40.speaker: Thulla
40.text: But here - I nabbed these boots from the greys when I ran. I'll feel better knowing you're using 'em to kick some duergar arse.
40.context: NodeContext: Handing us a pair of boots she stole from the duergar

223.speaker: Thulla
223.text: I'll mark where I made my escape. And... wait here, I suppose. Not much choice, eh?

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Sorry. You're going to have to save them yourself.
13.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but furious at herself for letting herself even expect that we'd help

72.speaker: Thulla
72.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but furious at herself for letting herself even expect that we'd help

16.speaker: Thulla
16.context: NodeContext: Looking around, a little despairing

84.speaker: Player
84.text: What are the duergar digging for?
84.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, unconcerned - wants us to focus on helping her people

98.speaker: Thulla
98.text: Some dusty temple. It doesn't matter. They'll work my clan to death before they ever get near it.
98.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, unconcerned - wants us to focus on helping her people

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Does there have to be a reason?
70.context: NodeContext: Wry. We helped her, but she's not the type to believe in do-gooders

189.speaker: Thulla
189.context: NodeContext: Wry. We helped her, but she's not the type to believe in do-gooders

217.speaker: Thulla
217.text: Ngh. But I'm nearly good to get on my feet.
217.context: NodeContext: She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: It's always useful to be owed a favour.
126.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Help? No. I just want to prolong your pain - at my hands.
162.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

55.speaker: Thulla
55.text: Should've known - you lot're cruel to the marrow. Well I ain't suffering you easily.
55.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I need my slaves healthy and mobile. Now up - we're leaving.
159.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

227.speaker: Thulla
227.text: Should've - ngh - known. I'll die before I go one step with you.
227.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Not all duergar are slavers, you know.
169.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I'm not really a drow - this is just a disguise.
186.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

93.speaker: Thulla
93.text: You're faking at being a drow? In the Underdark? I'm not sure if that's genius or suicide.
93.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

60.speaker: Thulla
60.text: But appearances aside, glad you came along. I have to go - got kin who need me.
60.context: NodeContext: Grateful but preoccupied. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'm not really a duergar - this is just a disguise.
76.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

178.speaker: Thulla
178.text: You're faking at being a duergar? In the Underdark? I'm not sure if that's genius or suicide.
178.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: We're kin. If we don't help one another, who will?
132.context: NodeContext: Grateful but preoccupied. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

0.speaker: Thulla
0.text: You're right. Got my own kin need helping, as soon as I'm on my feet.
0.context: NodeContext: Grateful but preoccupied. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: We're not all zealots - now you know.
238.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, grateful but wants to get on with things

14.speaker: Thulla
14.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, grateful but wants to get on with things

174.speaker: Player
174.text: No harm in a helping hand between Underdark folk.
174.context: NodeContext: Grateful. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

109.speaker: Thulla
109.text: You must have been away from here to think that. Not many willing to risk themselves for others right now.
109.context: NodeContext: Grateful. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Wounded creatures attract hungry creatures. We don't need that here.
160.context: NodeContext: Appreciative of the player's pragmatism. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

15.speaker: Thulla
15.text: Wise. Glad to run into someone with survival at heart.
15.context: NodeContext: Appreciative of the player's pragmatism. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Eye her boots. They must be the ones Gekh wants.
43.context: NodeContext: Almost feverish, beginning to lose her senses

224.speaker: Player
224.text: You're in a bad way. I could end your suffering, if you want.
224.context: NodeContext: Almost feverish, beginning to lose her senses

80.speaker: Thulla
80.text: Ngh. Hard to breathe. Blood's on fire...
80.context: NodeContext: Almost feverish, beginning to lose her senses

30.speaker: Thulla
30.text: Ngh. Hard to breathe. Blood's on fire...
30.context: NodeContext: Almost feverish, beginning to lose her senses

115.speaker: Thulla
115.context: NodeContext: Quiet, through gritted teeth. Begrudgingly allowing us to kill her before the pain takes her.

203.text: Can't give up. Others need me.
203.context: NodeContext: Shaking head with defiance. In agony, but won't give up.

142.speaker: Thulla
142.text: Can't give up. Others need me.
142.context: NodeContext: Shaking head with defiance. In agony, but won't give up.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: She's helpless. Check if she has anything worth taking.

222.speaker: Narrator
222.text: *Mostly junk, but her boots catch your eye.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Mostly junk, but her boots catch your eye.*

105.speaker: Thulla
105.context: NodeContext: No fool. She knows we're eyeing up her belongings and she's likely too weak to stop us.

170.speaker: Player
170.context: NodeContext: Helpless as the player steals her boots. Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

29.speaker: Thulla
29.context: NodeContext: Helpless as the player steals her boots. Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: She won't last long. Finish her off.

112.speaker: Thulla
112.text: A little more rest and I'll be ready to get out of here.
112.context: NodeContext: Keen to get going as soon as she's able,

116.speaker: Thulla
116.text: A little more rest and I'll be ready to get out of here.
116.context: NodeContext: Keen to get going as soon as she's able,

117.speaker: Thulla
117.text: I'd be dead if it weren't for some passing stranger. Kindness is rare currency down here.
117.context: NodeContext: Impressed by the charity she received (from someone other than the person she's speaking to right now)

141.speaker: Thulla
141.context: NodeContext: Vaguely stunned, dawning comprehension. We've healed her.

200.speaker: Thulla
200.text: Either... I'm finally dead, or you healed me. Why?
200.context: NodeContext: Sizing up her injuries, suspicous

157.speaker: Thulla
157.text: Mum, will you put the kettle on? I want to chat. Just us.

167.speaker: Thulla
167.text: Argh...I'm coming along. Just not fast enough. Any word on my people?
167.context: NodeContext: Gasping at ache. Frustrated she's not healing quicker.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: The duergar are all dead, but your kin didn't survive.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I found your people. I'm afraid they didn't survive.

124.speaker: Thulla
124.text: They're... they're dead? I'm alone? No...

48.speaker: Player
48.context: NodeContext: We just told her there was another gnome survivor - Thulla is bitter that their fanatacism got the others killed (in her eyes).

128.speaker: Thulla
128.text: Phil... of course she did. Diehards for the cause, both of us. No cost too great, eh?
128.context: NodeContext: We just told her there was another gnome survivor - Thulla is bitter that their fanatacism got the others killed (in her eyes).

85.speaker: Thulla
85.context: NodeContext: Angry at herself. 'Leave me' is half command, half pleading

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I'm sorry. I did everything I could.
71.context: NodeContext: Angry at herself. 'Leave me' is half command, half pleading

213.speaker: Thulla
213.text: I should've been with them. Should've died with them. Leave me.
213.context: NodeContext: Angry at herself. 'Leave me' is half command, half pleading

231.speaker: Player
231.text: What did you expect? You left them behind.
231.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, can't deal with us.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: You're not alone. We'll meet again - in better circumstances, I hope.
201.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, can't deal with us.

75.speaker: Thulla
75.text: I know you mean well, but... leave me. Please.
75.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, can't deal with us.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Don't mourn. You took your freedom - they waited for it to be handed to them.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: You already know how to stand alone. You'll be fine.

137.speaker: Thulla
137.text: I don't... I didn't mean to leave them. Leave me, please.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Remember them well. The grief will fade, but their memory need not.

241.speaker: Thulla
241.text: I don't want memories. I want... I want them. Leave me, please.

17.speaker: Thulla
17.text: It's Ironhand we favoured most. Seems he didn't favour us back. Leave me, please.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: You're not alone. Your path home is just a little longer than theirs.

195.speaker: Thulla
195.text: I don't want your prayers, priest. I know you mean well, but... leave me, please.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I'll send them your way. I already killed the duergar holding them captive.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I've saved them. Expect to see them here soon.

52.speaker: Thulla
52.text: You did...? Then I owe you more than I can ever repay. Thank you.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Remind me - what do I need to do?
173.context: NodeContext: Reiterating what she wants us to do. On the mend.

148.speaker: Thulla
148.text: Like I said, save my kin. And if you kill any duergar, you won't see tears from me.
148.context: NodeContext: Reiterating what she wants us to do. On the mend.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I've killed the duergar that were hunting you.
28.context: NodeContext: Ferociously happy at what she hears

219.speaker: Thulla
219.text: I'm almost sorry to hear it - I hoped to have the pleasure myself.
219.context: NodeContext: Ferociously happy at what she hears

110.speaker: Thulla
110.text: There's plenty more guarding my people. But I'd say you've made a fine start.
110.context: NodeContext: Reminding us there's more to do, hoping we kill the other duergar too

208.speaker: Player
208.text: You're popular. There are some duergar hunters looking for you.

35.speaker: Thulla
35.text: Hunters? Scavengers, more like. Waiting out there in the dark for me to die.

152.speaker: Thulla
152.text: Course, I reckon the myconids are doing the same thing. You've seen how they put the dead to work.
152.context: NodeContext: A little rueful - she's grateful the myconids helped, but a little creeped out by them

120.speaker: Thulla
120.text: This damned place. Once my people are free, I promise you - we will not be coming back.
120.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head - sick of the Underdark

90.speaker: Player
90.text: How long before you're fit to move?

134.speaker: Thulla
134.text: Don't know. Longer than I'd like. But a slow recovery's still a recovery.

184.speaker: Thulla
184.text: Damn thief. Just leave me be.
184.context: NodeContext: Angry at us, but still poisoned. We stole from her and she's helpless to do anything about it.

188.speaker: Thulla
188.text: What? You see to your affairs, I'll see to mine.
188.context: NodeContext: Annoyed - we refused to help her previously

181.speaker: Thulla
181.context: NodeContext: Sounding us out - still annoyed, but pragmatic enough to know she needs us

228.speaker: Thulla
228.text: On the mend now, thanks to a stranger. Much longer and I'd have been with Earthcaller.
228.context: NodeContext: Impressed by the charity she received (from someone other than the person she's speaking to right now)
